intro.headline: Thomas Weber
intro.subtext: Aerial imagery, orthomosaics, and 3D modeling for modern projects.

services.title: Aerial Photo / Video
services.subtitle: Turning aerial footage into useful site data.
services.description:
Aerial photo and video capture more than visuals — they capture information. Each flight produces imagery that can be processed into orthomosaics, 3D models, point clouds, and volume data, giving teams a measurable, data-backed view of their site.

This makes drone footage a cost-effective way to combine marketing visuals, inspection insights, and spatial analysis in one workflow.

value: Deliver clear context and scale for stakeholders — no scaffolding required.
Eliminate guesswork: orthographic angles and repeatable flight paths allow for precise comparison over time.
Capture cinematic material that's ready for both analysis and marketing.
Reduce time on-site while improving safety and documentation quality.

videoSections.title: Orbit Shots for Progress and Presentation
videoSections.body:
Orbit shots create smooth, circular captures of a site — perfect for marketing reels, visual progress updates, and cross-checks between planned and actual development.

While primarily visual, these flights can still generate georeferenced imagery that supports documentation and reporting.
usps: Ideal for combining visual storytelling with traceable site records.
Helps teams verify changes across phases with clear, consistent imagery.

videoSections.title: 360° Site Perspectives for Spatial Context
videoSections.body: Full-rotation flights collect data that goes beyond video. The captured imagery can be transformed through photogrammetry into orthomosaics, textured 3D meshes, or point clouds — delivering both visual and analytical value.
usps: Supports measurable outputs such as area, elevation, and volume analysis.
Useful for creating progress overlays, CAD comparisons, or timeline visualizations.
A single 360° dataset can feed multiple deliverables — from inspection layers to presentation renders.

videoSections.title: Inspection Passes for Remote Analysis
videoSections.body:
Low-altitude tracking passes provide detailed coverage for condition assessment, progress validation, and safety monitoring — reducing the need for frequent site visits.

Captured imagery can be processed into scaled surface maps or local 3D reconstructions for targeted analysis.
usps: Enables teams to review and measure site elements directly from the collected data, anytime and anywhere.

services.title: Orthomosaics
services.subtitle: The big picture, measured and mapped.
services.description:
A single flight can produce hundreds of overlapping photos — stitched into one geo-referenced, true-to-scale orthomosaic map.

These maps provide centimeter-level accuracy, allowing teams to measure areas, distances, and elevation change directly from the data.

Beyond visuals, orthomosaics form the base layer for 3D modeling, volume calculations, and site documentation that supports planning, reporting, and communication.

pillars.title: Accuracy at scale
pillars.body: High-resolution imagery with centimeter-level precision. Measure, annotate, and compare without needing multiple site visits.

pillars.title: Progress you can trust
pillars.body: Consistent flight paths mean data can be repeated week-to-week or phase-to-phase for reliable, measurable comparisons.

pillars.title: Operational clarity
pillars.body: One shared, map-based reference for managers, engineers, and contractors — everyone looking at the same, accurate data.

services.title: 3D Models
services.subtitle: Explorable detail that connects visuals with data.
services.description:
3D models turn aerial footage into accurate, interactive site representations. They’re not just visuals — they’re measurable, shareable, and data-rich.

Each model provides real-world geometry for checking clearances, documenting progress, or comparing designs directly against reality.

Teams can explore sites virtually, extract measurements, and overlay models with CAD or GIS data to align plans with actual conditions.
